list_ex_of_english: We have a number of real jewels of reactionary prose.
They are the jewels in the crown of this country.
There is no reason to think that the jewels are state property; they are royal property.
Courtiers played their parts in carefully selected clothes; jewelled hats, white satins, tawny velvets, orange taffetas.
The drive for material goods is non-existent as they view items such as jewels and gold as nothing greater than litter on the streets.
They are the most precious and the greatest jewels in the crown that we hold.
They threw in earth, pens, paper, jewels and gold, and the chasm remained unfilled.
